title: A Special Watch from the Titanic Sells for a Lot of Money
summary: A gold pocket watch that belonged to a rich passenger on the Titanic was sold for £1.78 million at an auction. The watch was found on Isidor Straus, who died when the Titanic sank in 1912 after hitting an iceberg. He was a businessman who owned Macy's store. His wife Ida also died because she did not want to leave him. The watch stopped at 2:20 AM, the time the ship sank. It was a birthday gift from Ida. Other items from the Titanic were sold too, like a letter and a passenger list. The auction made £3 million in total. People are still very interested in the Titanic story after 113 years.

background_read: The Titanic was a huge ship that set sail in 1912 from England to America. It was called 'unsinkable' but hit an iceberg and sank, causing many people to die. Isidor Straus was a wealthy man who owned a big store. His story shows how families remember loved ones through special items like watches and letters.
Article_Structure: WHO: Isidor Straus, a rich passenger and businessman
WHAT: His gold pocket watch sold for a record price at auction
WHERE: At an auction house in Devizes, Wiltshire, and originally from the Titanic ship
WHY: Because people are fascinated by the Titanic story and want to own pieces of history

perspectives.description: People care about the Titanic because it was a big disaster with many stories.
The Straus family kept the watch for years to remember their ancestors.
